question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Be sure to ensure the generated code is executable. Help me create a usable production calculation calculator packaged as software.

checklist.title: Is the basic calculation functionality implemented correctly?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the calculator includes essential production calculation features: input validation, formula parsing, unit conversion, and result formatting. Score 0 if basic arithmetic operations are missing, 5 if only simple calculations are supported, and 10 if comprehensive production formulas (including rate calculations, efficiency metrics, etc.) are implemented.

checklist.title: Is the software properly packaged for distribution?
checklist.description: Check if the code includes proper packaging mechanisms (executable generation, installer creation, dependency bundling). Verify if environment-specific configurations are handled, and if cross-platform compatibility is considered where appropriate. Deduct 5 points if the packaging process is manual, 3 points if dependency management is incomplete. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the calculator include industry-specific production formulas?
checklist.description: Assess whether the calculator incorporates specialized production calculations relevant to manufacturing industries (yield calculations, throughput estimations, cycle time computations, etc.). Deduct 5 points if only generic calculations are available without industry context. Score 10 if comprehensive industry-specific formulas are included with appropriate documentation.

checklist.title: Is there data persistence and export functionality?
checklist.description: Evaluate if the calculator can save calculation history, user preferences, and custom formulas. Check for export capabilities to common formats (CSV, PDF, etc.) and integration with other systems. Deduct 5 points if saving is limited to session only, and 3 points if export options are restrictive. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as invalid inputs, division by zero, memory limitations, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Real-time visualization of calculation trends 2. Template system for common production scenarios 3. Integration with material databases). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar calculation methods 2. Function modules unrelated to production calculations (e.g., unnecessary multimedia components) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive animations in a calculation tool). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating calculation logic/UI/data persistence layers), unit test coverage, and build process automation. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if the build process is not automated. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system (body font size ≥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Calculation response time ≤ 100ms 2) Input field navigation and transition smoothness 3) Clear visual feedback for calculation processes. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for noticeable lag during complex calculations, and 5 points for unintuitive UI interactions that impede workflow. The full score is 10 points.
